#LOAD LIBRARIES #
```{r}
library(tidyr)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
```

#IMPORT DATA#
```{r}
# Import Raw Nanodrop Data #
df <- readxl::read_xlsx("data/Nanodrop/Past_Nano_Working_Master.xlsx") 

# Import Additional Sample Data #
sd <- readxl::read_xlsx("data/Nanodrop/Past_Sample_Data.xlsx")
sd$Sample_ID <- as.character(sd$Sample_ID)

# Combine Nanodata with Sample Data #
nano <- right_join(df, sd, by = "Sample_ID")

# Convert Character Columns to Numeric #
nano$ng_ul <- as.numeric(nano$ng_ul)
nano$A260 <- as.numeric(nano$A260)
nano$A280 <- as.numeric(nano$A280)
nano$r260_280 <- as.numeric(nano$r260_280)
nano$r260_230 <- as.numeric(nano$r260_230)
nano$'Cursor abs.' <- as.numeric(nano$'Cursor abs.')

# Round values to 2 decimal places #
nano$ng_ul <- round(nano$ng_ul, digits = 2)
nano$A260 <- round(nano$A260, digits = 2)
nano$A280 <- round(nano$A280, digits = 2)
nano$r260_280  <- round(nano$r260_280 , digits = 2)
nano$r260_230 <- round(nano$r260_230, digits = 2)
nano$'Cursor abs.'<- round(nano$'Cursor abs.', digits = 2)
```

# Filtering Good and Bad Samples
```{r}
# RNA Samples >= 20ng/uL AND 260/280 > 1.95 #
goodRNA <- nano %>%
  filter(ng_ul >= 20 & r260_280 >= 1.95)

# RNA Samples >= 20ng/uL BUT 260/280 < 1.95 #
needswork <- nano %>%
  filter(ng_ul >= 20 & r260_280 < 1.95)

# RNA Samples with little to no RNA # 
noRNA <- nano %>%
  filter(ng_ul < 5)

# RNA Samples with low yields, < 20ng/uL but > 5ng/uL
lowyield <- nano %>%
  filter(ng_ul < 20, ng_ul > 5)
```
